item.title: Lobsters Top Stories: Wednesday, September 4, 2024 at 11:10 AM UTC
item.description:
1. Firefox will consider a Rust implementation of JPEG-XL (31 points | 9 comments)
2. Swift creator Chris Lattner on Mojo & Roc (29 points | 8 comments)
3. retronews: TUI browser for HN and Lobsters emulating classical Usenet and mail readers (50 points | 13 comments)
4. YubiKey Security Advisory YSA-2024-03 (27 points | 14 comments)
5. LSP: the good, the bad, and the ugly (20 points | 5 comments)
6. It's not Rust, it's FreeBSD (and LLVM) (32 points | 4 comments)
7. Greppability is an underrated code metric (45 points | 27 comments)
8. Yubikey is the Digital Seat Belt We Need Today (17 points | 26 comments)
9. Beyond Ctrl-C: The dark corners of Unix signal handling (4 points | 9 comments)
10. In practice, abstractions hide their underlying details (6 points | 2 comments)
11. Setting up a cache server for apt packages (23 points | 9 comments)
12. A TUI for sniffing network traffic using eBPF on Linux (10 points | 2 comments)
13. Is this trait sealed, or not sealed — that is the question (10 points | 1 comment)
14. How to deadlock Tokio application in Rust with just a single mutex (15 points | 21 comments)
15. Interactive NixOS tests (3 points | no comments)
16. The Fundamental Law Of Software Dependencies (6 points | 4 comments)
17. zigimports: Unused imports remover for Zig (7 points | 2 comments)
18. gRPC: 5 Years Later, Is It Still Worth It? (6 points | 11 comments)
19. Departure Mono (115 points | 18 comments)
20. Python Programmers' Experience (18 points | 3 comments)
21. Terminfo, at this point in time, is a net-negative on the terminal ecosystem (52 points | 23 comments)
22. EUCLEAK: Side-Channel Attack on the YubiKey 5 Series (5 points | 1 comment)
23. Generating Chess Puzzles Fast with Rust and Stockfish (7 points | no comments)
24. the limb-metaphor for simplicity (3 points | 2 comments)
25. In Leak, Facebook Partner Brags About Listening to Your Phone’s Microphone to Serve Ads for Stuff You Mention (109 points | 131 comments)
item.guid: Lobsters Top Stories: Wednesday, September 4, 2024 at 11:10 AM UTC
